intro: Graphiosa, commonly known as the ghost orchid, is a rare and ethereal flowering plant native to the southeastern United States. It belongs to the orchid family, Orchidaceae, and is characterized by its delicate, white, lace-like flowers that resemble ghostly apparitions. The plant typically grows on the bark of trees, thriving in moist, shaded environments with high humidity. Its unique morphology includes a single, narrow leaf and a slender, unbranched stem. Due to its specific habitat requirements and limited distribution, Graphiosa is considered a vulnerable species.
